alert.note: Alert for Banner; Box Butte; Cheyenne; Dawes; Kimball; Morrill; North Sioux; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 30 at 5:51AM CST until January 30 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST THIS MORNING... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 9 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Western Nebraska Panhandle including Sioux, Dawes, Box Butte, Scotts Bluff, Morrill, Banner, Kimball, and Cheyenne counties. This includes the cities of Harrison, Chadron, Alliance, Scottsbluff, Kimball, and Sidney. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, until 11 AM MST this morning. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 9 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Dangerously cold wind chills could lead to hypothermia and can cause frostbite on exposed skin in 30 minutes or less.
info.instruction: Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, including a knit hat and mittens.

area.areaDesc: Banner; Box Butte; Cheyenne; Dawes; Kimball; Morrill; North Sioux; Scotts Bluff; South Sioux
